book.title: Gentoo Linux 2008.0 x86 Networkless Handbook
book.author: Pierre-Henri Jondot
book.abstract: This is the Gentoo Networkless Handbook, an effort to centralise Gentoo/Linux information. This handbook contains the installation instructions for a networkless installation on x86 systems and parts about working with Gentoo and Portage.

part.title: Installing Gentoo
part.abstract: In this part you learn how to install Gentoo on your system.

chapter.title: About the Gentoo Linux Installation
chapter.abstract: Users not familiar with Gentoo do not always know that choice is what Gentoo is all about.

chapter.title: Booting the Installer LiveCD
chapter.abstract: Using our Installer LiveCD you can boot up your system into a running environment that allows you to install Gentoo.

chapter.title: Using the GTK+ based Gentoo Linux Installer
chapter.abstract: You now have an option of using our graphical installer to install Gentoo. Configure the options you need through an easy to use GUI and you're ready to go.

chapter.title: Using the Dialog based Gentoo Linux Installer
chapter.abstract: You also have an option of using our text based installer to install Gentoo. Configure the options you need through an easy to use set of menus and you're ready to go.

chapter.title: Where to go from here?
chapter.abstract: Now you have your Gentoo system, but what's next?

part.title: Working with Gentoo
part.abstract: Learn how to work with Gentoo: installing software, altering variables, changing Portage behaviour etc.

chapter.title: A Portage Introduction
chapter.abstract: This chapter explains the "simple" steps a user definitely needs to know to maintain the software on his system.

chapter.title: USE flags
chapter.abstract: USE flags are a very important aspect of Gentoo. In this chapter, you learn to work with USE flags and understand how USE flags interact with your system.

chapter.title: Portage Features
chapter.abstract: Discover the features Portage has, such as support for distributed compiling, ccache and more.

chapter.title: Initscripts
chapter.abstract: Gentoo uses a special initscript format which, amongst other features, allows dependency-driven decisions and virtual initscripts. This chapter explains all these aspects and explains how to deal with these scripts.

chapter.title: Environment Variables
chapter.abstract: With Gentoo you can easily manage the environment variables for your system. This chapter explains how you do that, and also describes frequently used variables.

part.title: Working with Portage
part.abstract: "Working with Portage" provides an in-depth coverage of Portage, Gentoo's Software Management Tool.

chapter.title: Files and Directories
chapter.abstract: Once you want to know Portage in-depth you need to know where it stores its files and data.

chapter.title: Configuring through Variables
chapter.abstract: Portage is completely configurable through various variables you can set in the configuration file or as environment variable.

chapter.title: Mixing Software Branches
chapter.abstract: Gentoo provides software separated in several branches, depending on stability and architectural support. "Mixing Software Branches" inform you how these branches can be configured and how you can override this separation individually.

chapter.title: Additional Portage Tools
chapter.abstract: Portage comes with a few extra tools that might make your Gentoo experience even better. Read on to discover how to use dispatch-conf and other tools.

chapter.title: Diverting from the Official Tree
chapter.abstract: "Diverting from the Official Tree" gives you some tips and tricks on how to use your own Portage tree, how to synchronise only the categories you want, inject packages and more.

part.title: Gentoo Network Configuration
part.abstract: A comprehensive guide to Networking in Gentoo.

chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.abstract: A guide to quickly get your network interface up and running in most common environments.

chapter.title: Advanced Configuration
chapter.abstract: Here we learn about how the configuration works - you need to know this before we learn about modular networking.

chapter.title: Modular Networking
chapter.abstract: Gentoo provides you flexible networking - here you are told about choosing different DHCP clients, setting up bonding, bridging, VLANs and more.

chapter.title: Wireless Networking
chapter.abstract: Wireless isn't straight-forward. Hopefully we'll get you working!

chapter.title: Adding Functionality
chapter.abstract: If you're feeling adventurous, you can add your own functions to networking.

chapter.title: Network Management
chapter.abstract: For laptop users or people who move their computer around different networks.
